what: Parse YMD Format Number or String to Date
title: Parse YMD Format Number or String to Date
text: Convert ‘YMD’ format number string Date efficiently, e.g., 211225 .Date("2021-12-25"), using Rust’s standard library. also provides helper functions handle Date, e.g., quick finding beginning ending given period, adding months Date, etc. ’s similar lubridate package much lighter focuses Date objects.

title: Parse YMD Format Number or String to Date

title: Parse YMD Format Number or String to Date
code: print_bmk <- function(x) {   x[[1]] <- format(x[[1]])   x[[5]] <- format(x[[5]])   rnd <- \(v) if (is.numeric(v)) round(v, 1) else v   x[, 1:9] |> lapply(rnd) |> as.data.frame() |> knitr::kable() |> print() } x <- c("210101", "21/02/03", "89-1-03", "1989.03.05", "01 02 03") x <- rep(x, 100) bench::mark(   ymd::ymd(x),   lubridate::ymd(x), time_unit = "us" ) |> print_bmk() x <- c(210101, 210224, 211231, 19890103) x <- rep(x, 100) bench::mark(   ymd::ymd(x),   lubridate::ymd(x), time_unit = "us" ) |> print_bmk() x <- c("2021-01-01", "2022-12-31", "1995-03-22") x <- rep(x, 100) bench::mark(   ymd::ymd(x),   lubridate::ymd(x), time_unit = "us",   as.Date(x) ) |> print_bmk() x <- ymd::ymd(210515) + 1:100 bench::mark(   ymd::eop$tm(x),   lubridate::ceiling_date(x, "month") - 1, time_unit = "us" ) |> print_bmk() `%m+%` <- lubridate::`%m+%` x <- ymd::ymd(c(200115, 200131, 200229, 200331, 200401)) x <- rep(x, 100) bench::mark(   ymd::edate(x, 2),   x %m+% months(2), time_unit = "us" ) |> print_bmk() bench::mark(   ymd::edate(x, -12),   x %m+% months(-12), time_unit = "us" ) |> print_bmk()

what: Find the Beginning or Ending of Period — beop
title: Find the Beginning or Ending of Period — beop
text: bop eop contains list functions, whose names consist two letters, first stands last, , next second stands year, quarter, month, week. example, eop$ty() means "ending period year" bop$lm() means "beginning period last month".

title: Find the Beginning or Ending of Period — beop
text: functions' signatures , one argument x, Date values can converted Date via ymd().

title: Find the Beginning or Ending of Period — beop

what: Convert 'YMD' format integer or string to Date — ymd
title: Convert 'YMD' format integer or string to Date — ymd
text: Transform integer strings vectors 'YMD' format Date objects. intends support limited formats (separator one '.', ' ', '-' '/' separators). See possible formats examples.

title: Convert 'YMD' format integer or string to Date — ymd
Convert 'YMD' format integer or string to Date — ymd
text: x integer string vector 'YMD' format. Double values without decimal part allowed.

title: Convert 'YMD' format integer or string to Date — ymd
text: Date object. parse fails certain input, value returned NA, silently.
